concept.shortdesc: A is a secure key token. Any key generation is processed in a . A clear key is generated and wrapped by a master key which resides only within the . The clear key is then deleted and is never visible outside the coprocessor. The wrapped clear key is called a secure key and can only be unwrapped by using the master key within the coprocessor. Secure keys can safely be stored on a system, because they cannot be used for decrypting or encrypting without the master key.
